details.description: A fire engulfs a 10-foot-by-10-foot section of forest, then spreads on each of its turns.
details.disable:
A successful @Check[type:athletics|dc:15|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire], @Check[type:nature|dc:15|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire], or @Check[type:survival|dc:15|name:Smother Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire] check from an adjacent square is sufficient to smother one 5-foot-square of fire; each attempt is an Interact action. Dousing the flames automatically extinguishes one or more sections of fire, with no check. Water typically clears a 5-foot square if the amount is small (such as that from @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Create Water]{Create Water} or @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Hydraulic Push]{Hydraulic Push}). Larger amounts of water, such as a full bucket, typically douse a 10-foot-by-10-foot area (or 4 squares in some other shape). Throwing a bucket of water on flames requires an Interact action. A @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Waterskin]{Waterskin} doesn't contain enough water to put out even 1 square of fire.

Cold can also put out fire, but only if the cold can affect an area; cold is usually less effective than water, so a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Frost Vial (Lesser)]{Frost Vial} typically puts out only 1 square of fire, and @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Ray of Frost]{Ray of Frost} is ineffective.
details.routine: On its turn, the fire spreads into a number of additional squares equal to half the number of squares the fire currently occupies, minimum 1 square. The GM determines the squares the fire spreads into. Any creature that ends its turn next to the flames takes [[/r {1d6}[fire]]]{1d6 fire damage}, and any creature within the flames takes [[/r {4d6}[fire]]]{4d6 fire damage} (@Check[type:reflex|dc:15|basic:true|name:Raging Forest Fire|traits:hazard,environmental,fire] save for both). A creature can take damage from flames only once per round.

source.value: Pathfinder Society Scenario #1-15: The Blooming Catastrophe
